paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper primarily discusses a case report of a patient with BRAF-mutated metastatic colorectal cancer. A BRCA2 variant is mentioned in the context of genetic testing results, but no detailed penetrance or functional data is provided for BRCA2.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: NGS testing identified BRAFV600E mutation with extended wild-type RAS. Other genetic anomalies identified by NGS included the following mutations and amplifications: BRCA2D306V, ATMR337C, L1814F, RNF43R132, TP53R248W, Myc (copy number increase), and MCL1 (copy number increase).

functional_data.summary: No functional data provided for BRCA2D306V.

variants.additional_notes: The clinical relevance of the BRCA2D306V variant in CRC is not established.
key_quotes: NGS testing identified BRAFV600E mutation with extended wild-type RAS. Other genetic anomalies identified by NGS included the following mutations and amplifications: BRCA2D306V, ATMR337C, L1814F, RNF43R132, TP53R248W, Myc (copy number increase), and MCL1 (copy number increase).

challenges: Limited information on BRCA2 variant significance and penetrance.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focuses on BRAF mutations in colorectal cancer, with limited data on BRCA2.
